metadata.Title: CVE-2017-0794 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A elevation of privilege vulnerability in the Upstream kernel scsi driver.Product: Android. Versions: Android kernel. Android ID: A-35644812.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0794` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-161-generic - 3.13.0-161.211
linux-image-3.13.0-161-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-161.211
linux-image-3.13.0-161-lowlatency - 3.13.0-161.211
linux-image-3.13.0-161-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-161.211
linux-image-3.13.0-161-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-161.211
linux-image-3.13.0-161-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-161.211
linux-image-3.13.0-161-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-161.211
linux-image-3.13.0-161-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-161.211
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-161-generic - 3.13.0-161.211
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-98-generic - 4.4.0-98.121~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-98-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-98.121~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-98-lowlatency - 4.4.0-98.121~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-98.121~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-98.121~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-98.121~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-98.121~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-98-generic - 4.4.0-98.121~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-161.211').
